__TOC__



Tags provide us ways to group bugs across packages, easily find certain types of bugs or divide a package's bug reports into smaller parts.<<BR>><<BR>>Below are some standard tags and information about when to use the tag when working on bug reports about Ubuntu. 

=== Different ways you can help ===

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <rowbgcolor="#FFEBBB"> '''Tag'''
| '''Use case'''
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=bitesize|bitesize]]</nowiki>
| This bug is easy to fix and suitable for new contributors.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-artwork|needs-artwork]]</nowiki>
| A bug that needs new artwork to be created
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-coding|needs-coding]]</nowiki>
| A bug that needs new source code to be written
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-design|needs-design]]</nowiki>
| A bug that needs UI design done first
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-packaging|needs-packaging]]</nowiki>
| Packaging requests - software that isn't packaged for Ubuntu yet
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-sound|needs-sound]]</nowiki>
| A bug that needs new sound to be created
|}

=== Generic bug tags ===

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <rowbgcolor="#FFEBBB"> '''Tag'''
| '''Use case'''
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=apport-bug|apport-bug]]</nowiki>
| A bug reported using "Report a Problem" in an application's Help menu contains lots of details!
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=apport-collected|apport-collected]]</nowiki>
| A bug that has had apport-collect ran against it which will contain additional information.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=apport-crash|apport-crash]]</nowiki>
| A crash reported by apport - Ubuntu's automated problem reporter.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=apport-package|apport-package]]</nowiki>
| A bug reported by apport when a package operation failed.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=package-conflict|package-conflict]]</nowiki>
| A bug reported by apport when a package operation failed due to a conflict with a file provided by another package.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bugs?field.tag=derivatives|derivatives]]</nowiki>
| Bugs related to Derivatives.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=desktop-file|desktop-file]]</nowiki>
| The bug requests the addition/fix of a .desktop file.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.status:list=FIXRELEASED&field.tag=fix-to-verify|fix-to-verify]]</nowiki>
| A bug that is Fix Released and should be verified when performing iso testing of daily builds or milestones.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=ftbfs|ftbfs]]</nowiki>
| Bugs describing build failures of packages.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bugs?field.tag=gobuntu|gobuntu]]</nowiki>
| Bugs related to Gobuntu.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=hw-specific|hw-specific]]</nowiki>
| A bug that requires a specific piece of hardware to duplicate.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=iso-testing|iso-testing]]</nowiki>
| A bug found when performing <nowiki>[[https://iso.qa.ubuntu.com/|iso testing]]</nowiki>.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=likely-dup|likely-dup]]</nowiki>
| The bug is likely a duplicate of another bug ((maybe an upstream bug too) but you can't find it.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=manpage|manpage]]</nowiki>
| This bug is about a package's manpage being incorrect.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=metabug|metabug]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a high probability of duplicate reports being filed.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=multiarch|multiarch]]</nowiki>
| This bug is due to an issue with the new <nowiki>[[http://wiki.debian.org/Multiarch|multiarch triplet paths]]</nowiki>, this can be build time, install time, or run time issues.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=nautilus-desktop-icons|nautilus-desktop-icons]]</nowiki>
| Bugs related to the Nautilus desktop, especially the alignment, display and grid of icons.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?orderby=-importance&field.status%3Alist=New&field.status%3Alist=Incomplete&field.status%3Alist=Invalid&field.status%3Alist=Won%27t+Fix&field.status%3Alist=Confirmed&field.status%3Alist=Triaged&field.status%3Alist=In+Progress&field.status%3Alist=Fix+Committed&field.status%3Alist=Fix+Released&field.tag=needs-devrelease-testing&search=Search|needs-devrelease-testing]]</nowiki>
| A bug that existed in a previous release of Ubuntu and needs to be tested in the latest development release.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-reassignment|needs-reassignment]]</nowiki>
| A bug that was reported about the wrong package but the package maintainer isn't sure which package it belongs to.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=packaging|packaging]]</nowiki>
| The bug is likely to be a packaging mistake.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=screencast|screencast]]</nowiki>
| This bug report includes a screencast of the bug in action!
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=string-fix|string-fix]]</nowiki>
| This bug is a string fix (not code) and is great for new contributors. For spelling and grammatical errors.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=touch|touch]]</nowiki>
| an issue with touch support in applications or X.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=triage-mentoring-available|triage-mentoring-available]]</nowiki>
| This bug has been identified as one that could use some additional information and another triager is offering guidance for getting that information.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=units-policy|units-policy]]</nowiki>
| A bug that violates the UnitsPolicy.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=unmetdeps|unmetdeps]]</nowiki>
| Bugs that indicate packages not being installable due to missing dependencies.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=upgrade-software-version|upgrade-software-version]]</nowiki>
| Bugs that request new software versions - please help reviewing them carefully.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=work-intensive|work-intensive]]</nowiki>
| triaging requires intensive work to validate/reproduce.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=dist-upgrade|dist-upgrade]]</nowiki>
| A bug that was encountered when upgrading between releases of Ubuntu.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=testcase|testcase]]</nowiki>
| A bug which contains a test case - steps to recreate the bug.
|}

|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tags_combinator=ALL&field.tag=suspend+resume|suspend-resume]]</nowiki>
| This bug was triggered by a suspend/resume failure.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=xorg-needs-kernel-fix|xorg-needs-kernel-fix]]</nowiki>

==== Patch specific ====

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch|patch]]</nowiki>
| A patch in its final form, and can immediately be released into the appropriate Ubuntu repository as outlined in <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/Patches]]</nowiki>. A raw patch copied from an external location, or possible/test/draft patches wouldn't fit this criteria.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-accepted-debian|patch-accepted-debian]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that has been accepted by Debian.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-accepted-upstream|patch-accepted-upstream]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that has been accepted by upstream.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-forwarded-debian|patch-forwarded-debian]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that has been forwarded to Debian.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-forwarded-upstream|patch-forwarded-upstream]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that has been forwarded upstream.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-needswork|patch-needswork]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that needs some work done on it.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-rejected|patch-rejected]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that was not included in Ubuntu.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-rejected-debian|patch-rejected-debian]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that has been rejected by Debian.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-rejected-upstream|patch-rejected-upstream]]</nowiki>
| This bug has a patch attached to it that has been rejected by upstream.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=patch-upstreaminput|patch-upstreaminput]]</nowiki>

==== Regression specific ====

See the <nowiki>[[http://qa.ubuntu.com/reports/regression/regression_tracker.html|regression tracker]]</nowiki> for a list of these bugs and <nowiki>[[QATeam-RegressionTracking]]</nowiki> for more information.

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <rowbgcolor="#FFEBBB"> '''Tag'''
| '''Use case'''
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=regression-release|regression-release]]</nowiki>
| A bug in a release that was not present in a previous release. Should be used together with a separate tag for the release the regression was found in. This also applies to a development release where an update introduces a regression prior to its official release.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=regression-update|regression-update]]</nowiki>
| A bug in a stable release that was introduced by a package from -updates. This would not apply to a development release where a regression was introduced prior to its official release.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=regression-proposed|regression-proposed]]</nowiki>
| A bug in a stable release of Ubuntu that was found when testing a package from -proposed.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=regression-retracer|regression-retracer]]</nowiki>
| An apport crash bug report that was identified by the retracer as having the same characteristics as a fixed crash report.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-bisect|needs-bisect]]</nowiki>
| This is for when a bisect is requested or required to fix the bug.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=needs-bisect|performing-bisect]]</nowiki>
| The reporter, developer, or triager is in the process of performing a bisection.
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=bisect-done|bisect-done]]</nowiki>
| Add when a bisect has been completed and the offending commit(s) identified.
|}

==== Release Specific ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <rowbgcolor="#FFEBBB"> '''Tag'''
| '''Use case'''

{| class="wikitable"
|-

| '''Use case'''
|-

|-

|}
